results.abstract: The kind of critically praised dramas that often dominate the awards season are falling flat at the box office, failing to justify the money it takes to make them.

results.byline: By Valerie Hopkins and Alan Yuhas
results.title: Who Is Viktor Bout, the Arms Dealer in the Swap for Brittney Griner?
results.abstract: Viktor Bout has been accused of supplying arms to Al Qaeda, the Taliban and rebels in Rwanda. His exploits helped inspire a 2005 film, “Lord of War,” that starred Nicolas Cage.

media.caption: Viktor Bout, a notorious Russian arms dealer, arriving at court in Bangkok in 2010. He was extradited and convicted of conspiring to kill Americans.

results.title: After 65 Years, the ‘Boy in the Box’ Has a Name
results.abstract: Detective work and DNA analysis helped officials learn the identity of a 4-year-old boy whose beaten body was found inside a cardboard box in Philadelphia in 1957. The killing remains unsolved.
org_facet: National Center for Missing and Exploited Children

media.caption: Capt. Jason Smith of the Philadelphia police, center, with William C. Fleisher of the Vidocq Society, a forensic investigative group, and the Philadelphia medical examiner, Dr. Constance DiAngelo, at a news conference on Thursday where the authorities identified a boy found dead in a cardboard box in 1957.
